column4: Can somebody explain to me why the hardy samba source does not compile in karmic?  I wouldn't be surprised if karmic -> hardy wouldn't work.  But this is kind of new to me.
I'm trying to pinpoint a regression
failure log is at https://launchpad.net/~r0lf/+archive/ppa/+build/1164451
did you get all the dev files... did you apt-get build-dep samba ?
I tried this in a pbuilder chroot.  The same goes for the PPA.
The build-time deps are automatically fulfilled
maybe a compiler change.. you know that karmic has a newer gcc   any errors?
https://launchpad.net/~r0lf/+archive/ppa/+build/1164451

it's saying you don't have apt-utils installed.. i don't know if that's the problem BUT... it looks like a linker problem similar to this one http://www.nabble.com/samba-3.2.6-link-error-td21018825.html
Thank you for taking a look.  But I don't really see any connection between either apt-utils nor the linker failure you posted the URL.
But I don't really see any connection between either apt-utils nor the linker failure you posted the URL on the one hand and the compile failure I saw on the other.
you can try to do a fresh build (autogen / configure / make everything) like the link said.. may even install apt-utils or  .,...just try nothing
Have you ever compiled something in pbuilder?
i'd try an autogen in the directory first
Have you ever compiled something in pbuilder?
yes i have and it doesn't give you the opportunity to do much... are you crosscompiling? is that why you need pbuilder?
no
What does cross-compiling have to do with it?
do you have something against dpkg-buildpackage or dhmake or friends?
pbuilder usually protects me from a lot of PEBKAC
Trying debuild instead of pdebuild seems like a step backwards in this case
And I can't see how it should help any.
but I'll give it a shot
That won't help much.   My build host is running hardy, too.
